hey dncc, a very good program to transfer avi to dvd with menu is called dvd flick. It is also free, check it out, I use it all the time.

@dncc - 70%?  depends what u r downloading - check the file ext and comments. stay away from .mkv files - pain in the ass and there's usually an avi or mp4 version as well. i use Nero 7 with only the flac audio plug in added and i never have a  problem. nero is up to at least 9 by now but the 7 version works great and has an easy interface. most people however rave about VLC, but i assume if you're watching on a DVD player your burning it back to DVD vid format anyway. good luck dude - your other solution is get an analog or dvi cable to hook your computer to your TV - then you never need to burn a disk, and it will play in it's native format
